question_text:
A shopper wants to ensure he has enough cash to purchase an $830 digital camera, so he asks a clerk what the total will be with the sales tax included. 
 The clerk tells him the total will be $913. What is the sales tax percentage?

Write your answer using a percent sign (%). For example, 0.5%, 12.7%, or 56%.
_
solution:
The percent of change formula can be used to find sales tax percentage. 
percentage = $\frac{\text{price with tax - price before tax}}{\text{price before tax}}$

Plug $830 and 
 $913 into the formula and simplify.

percentage = $\frac{\text{price with tax - price before tax}}{\text{price before tax}}$
=$\frac{\text{913 - 830}}{\text{830}}$
= $\frac{83}{830}$
=0.1

Write the number as a percent. 
$0.1 \rightarrow 10\%$
The sales tax percentage is 10%.

question_text:
Jeremiah bought an aquarium marked down from $25 
 to $21. What is the discount percentage?
Write your answer using a percent sign (%)
_
solution:
The percent of change formula can be used to find percent of discount. 
percentage = $\frac{\text{original price - discount price}}{\text{original price}}$

Plug $25 
 and $21 into the formula and simplify.

percent of discount = $\frac{\text{original price - discount price}}{\text{original price}}$
=$\frac{\text{25 - 21}}{\text{25}}$
= $\frac{4}{25}$
=0.16

Write the number as a percent. 
$0.16 \rightarrow 16\%$
The percentage of discount is 16%.

question_text:
A retailer sells swing sets for $406 that were acquired at a 
 cost of $280. What is the mark-up, as a percentage?

Write your answer using a percent sign (%).


_
solution:
The percent of change formula can be used to find percent of mark-up. 
percent of mark-up = $\frac{\text{selling price - purchase price}}{\text{purchase price}}$
Plug $280 and $406 into the formula and simplify.

percent of mark-up = $\frac{\text{selling price - purchase price}}{\text{purchase price}}$
=$\frac{\text{406 - 280}}{\text{280}}$
= $\frac{126}{280}$
=0.45

Write the number as a percent. 
$0.45 \rightarrow 45\%$
The percent of mark-up is 45%.

percent of mark-up = $\frac{\text{selling price - purchase price}}{\text{purchase price}}$
Plug $540 and $918 into the formula and simplify.

percent of mark-up = $\frac{\text{selling price - purchase price}}{\text{purchase price}}$
=$\frac{\text{918 - 540}}{\text{540}}$
= $\frac{378}{540}$
=0.7

Write the number as a percent. 
$0.7 \rightarrow 70\%$
The percent of mark-up is 70%.

question_text:
A bookcase costs a store $340 to acquire. The store sells it for $391. What is the mark-up percentage?

Write your answer using a percent sign (%).


_
solution:
The percent of change formula can be used to find percent of mark-up. 
percent of mark-up = $\frac{\text{selling price - purchase price}}{\text{purchase price}}$
Plug $340 and $391 into the formula and simplify.

percent of mark-up = $\frac{\text{selling price - purchase price}}{\text{purchase price}}$
=$\frac{\text{391 - 340}}{\text{340}}$
= $\frac{51}{340}$
=0.15

Write the number as a percent. 
$0.15 \rightarrow 15\%$
The percent of mark-up is 15%.
